column2: Don't call setLoggerFactory() of DefaultArtifactResolver and of Defau¡­

column3:
Those methods were removed by the MRESOLVER-36 task resolution of maven-resolver 1.3.0:
apache/maven-resolver@e197676
Tested with Maven 3.6.0 and also with Maven 3.5.4
Steps to test this fix or reproduce this bug before fix:
Add some dependency, for example this one:
Configure your IntelliJ IDEA to use Maven 3.6.0

Make sure you don't have sources of that dependency on your local Maven repository. In case of the above dependency in %HOMEDRIVE%%HOMEPATH%\.m2\repository\org\apache\commons\commons-lang3\3.8.1 files: commons-lang3-3.8.1-sources.jar and commons-lang3-3.8.1-sources.jar.sha1 must be removed.
By pressing Ctrl+N go to some class of the dependency, for example to StringUtils, and press to the "Download Sources" link in the top right side of the editor.
You may repeat steps 4 and 5 several times and with different Maven versions after closing that dependency class.
Have you submitted a contributor license agreement? If not, please follow the steps described at http://www.jetbrains.com/agreements/cla/ to sign it.
@klikh, I submitted a contributor license agreement now.
Thanks for the contribution! I've merged the PR using the following commit 655c0a6
